blog.name: knlalla
blog.title: ??¿¿?¿
blog.description:
katie || 24 || not straight || she/her || my ao3

hello lovelies thanks for joining me
tell me about your day

tags: i wrote this whilst listening to bad behavior (the acoustic version) by the maine
and try not to cry cause i totally am
summary: talk to me about how dan and phil are just like sleeping and detoxing with the curtains drawn and the covers pulled over their...
question: talk to me about how dan and phil are just like sleeping and detoxing with the curtains drawn and the covers pulled over their heads because thats what ive been thinking about for twelve hours
answer:
tash,,,,,,babe,,,,,

don’t imagine dan pushing through the door to their flat, suitcase rolling in behind him and phil just past it. don’t imagine phil reaching for the light switch, finger hovering over it as he watches dan stare at the dark space around them; don’t imagine him pausing, then, because dan’s just let the handle of his suitcase fall, and the whole thing clunks to the ground.

don’t imagine dan blatantly ignoring the noise, the barely-visible flat around him, ignoring phil’s soft ‘dan?’. don’t imagine him pushing through the partly-open door and into the pitch blackness of the moon room, too exhausted to bother with unpacking or laundry or suitcases or lights or changing clothes or really much of anything.

don’t imagine the moment phil pauses behind dan in the doorway, watches his progress toward the bed; don’t imagine his small smile at the familiar creak of the mattress under dan’s weight, a sound he feels in his heart even though it’s been months since he’s last heard it.

and then he makes his way over as well, to the spot - his, technically - that dan’s decided to occupy. don’t imagine phil smoothing his hand over the ruffled curls of dan’s hair, leaning down to press a brief kiss to his temple. 

and don’t imagine him walking away, because they have work to do. well, they don’t have much, just a video to upload. but phil can do that on his own, and dan can rest a few extra minutes. 

don’t imagine phil crawling into bed beside dan those few minutes later, a video uploaded, a tweet posted - and retweeted with dan’s account - and jeans swapped for a pair of his favorite pajama pants he’d left at home. don’t imagine the warmth he feels in his chest as he curls himself around dan, tugging at the duvet until he’s freed it from where dan had it pinned between him and the mattress so he can wrap it around them both, surround them with a familiarity they haven’t needed but have absolutely missed anyway.

don’t imagine the next morning - or, rather, the next afternoon - when dan finally stirs, turns himself in phil’s arms until they’re face to face, until dan can mumble a sleepy, smiley ‘good morning’ into phil’s chest.

and don’t imagine phil lifting dan’s chin, staring at the man he’s just conquered the world with, taking in this moment of same but also new, this moment of possibilities and potential and the future. don’t imagine the precipice phil feels they’re balanced on, the edge of something new and exciting and incredible - not because they have anything planned, but perhaps more because they don’t. 

and don’t imagine phil - the one who never cries over these sentimental things, that’s usually dan - with a tear in his eye, one that slips down and seeps into the pillow. don’t imagine him coughing out a breath of laughter at dan’s confusion. don’t imagine dan’s lips curling up when he realizes it isn’t a bad sort of crying - and dan considers himself an expert on all the different kinds of crying.

and don’t imagine phil thinking how far they’ve come, how he woke up next to dan just like this nearly nine years ago when they had no idea what the future would hold except that they were certain they’d be together. don’t imagine him grinning now, in spite of the tears, because he feels exactly the same way now - and even he can’t imagine how incredible their future will be.

(read the sequel - x)

tash,,,,,,babe,,,,,

don’t imagine dan pushing through the door to their flat, suitcase rolling in behind him and phil just past it. don’t imagine phil reaching for the light switch, finger hovering over it as he watches dan stare at the dark space around them; don’t imagine him pausing, then, because dan’s just let the handle of his suitcase fall, and the whole thing clunks to the ground.

don’t imagine dan blatantly ignoring the noise, the barely-visible flat around him, ignoring phil’s soft ‘dan?’. don’t imagine him pushing through the partly-open door and into the pitch blackness of the moon room, too exhausted to bother with unpacking or laundry or suitcases or lights or changing clothes or really much of anything.

don’t imagine the moment phil pauses behind dan in the doorway, watches his progress toward the bed; don’t imagine his small smile at the familiar creak of the mattress under dan’s weight, a sound he feels in his heart even though it’s been months since he’s last heard it.

and then he makes his way over as well, to the spot - his, technically - that dan’s decided to occupy. don’t imagine phil smoothing his hand over the ruffled curls of dan’s hair, leaning down to press a brief kiss to his temple. 

and don’t imagine him walking away, because they have work to do. well, they don’t have much, just a video to upload. but phil can do that on his own, and dan can rest a few extra minutes. 

don’t imagine phil crawling into bed beside dan those few minutes later, a video uploaded, a tweet posted - and retweeted with dan’s account - and jeans swapped for a pair of his favorite pajama pants he’d left at home. don’t imagine the warmth he feels in his chest as he curls himself around dan, tugging at the duvet until he’s freed it from where dan had it pinned between him and the mattress so he can wrap it around them both, surround them with a familiarity they haven’t needed but have absolutely missed anyway.

don’t imagine the next morning - or, rather, the next afternoon - when dan finally stirs, turns himself in phil’s arms until they’re face to face, until dan can mumble a sleepy, smiley ‘good morning’ into phil’s chest.

and don’t imagine phil lifting dan’s chin, staring at the man he’s just conquered the world with, taking in this moment of same but also new, this moment of possibilities and potential and the future. don’t imagine the precipice phil feels they’re balanced on, the edge of something new and exciting and incredible - not because they have anything planned, but perhaps more because they don’t. 

and don’t imagine phil - the one who never cries over these sentimental things, that’s usually dan - with a tear in his eye, one that slips down and seeps into the pillow. don’t imagine him coughing out a breath of laughter at dan’s confusion. don’t imagine dan’s lips curling up when he realizes it isn’t a bad sort of crying - and dan considers himself an expert on all the different kinds of crying.

and don’t imagine phil thinking how far they’ve come, how he woke up next to dan just like this nearly nine years ago when they had no idea what the future would hold except that they were certain they’d be together. don’t imagine him grinning now, in spite of the tears, because he feels exactly the same way now - and even he can’t imagine how incredible their future will be.

(read the sequel - x)
trail.content:
tash,,,,,,babe,,,,,

don’t imagine dan pushing through the door to their flat, suitcase rolling in behind him and phil just past it. don’t imagine phil reaching for the light switch, finger hovering over it as he watches dan stare at the dark space around them; don’t imagine him pausing, then, because dan’s just let the handle of his suitcase fall, and the whole thing clunks to the ground.

don’t imagine dan blatantly ignoring the noise, the barely-visible flat around him, ignoring phil’s soft ‘dan?’. don’t imagine him pushing through the partly-open door and into the pitch blackness of the moon room, too exhausted to bother with unpacking or laundry or suitcases or lights or changing clothes or really much of anything.

don’t imagine the moment phil pauses behind dan in the doorway, watches his progress toward the bed; don’t imagine his small smile at the familiar creak of the mattress under dan’s weight, a sound he feels in his heart even though it’s been months since he’s last heard it.

and then he makes his way over as well, to the spot - his, technically - that dan’s decided to occupy. don’t imagine phil smoothing his hand over the ruffled curls of dan’s hair, leaning down to press a brief kiss to his temple. 

and don’t imagine him walking away, because they have work to do. well, they don’t have much, just a video to upload. but phil can do that on his own, and dan can rest a few extra minutes. 

don’t imagine phil crawling into bed beside dan those few minutes later, a video uploaded, a tweet posted - and retweeted with dan’s account - and jeans swapped for a pair of his favorite pajama pants he’d left at home. don’t imagine the warmth he feels in his chest as he curls himself around dan, tugging at the duvet until he’s freed it from where dan had it pinned between him and the mattress so he can wrap it around them both, surround them with a familiarity they haven’t needed but have absolutely missed anyway.

don’t imagine the next morning - or, rather, the next afternoon - when dan finally stirs, turns himself in phil’s arms until they’re face to face, until dan can mumble a sleepy, smiley ‘good morning’ into phil’s chest.

and don’t imagine phil lifting dan’s chin, staring at the man he’s just conquered the world with, taking in this moment of same but also new, this moment of possibilities and potential and the future. don’t imagine the precipice phil feels they’re balanced on, the edge of something new and exciting and incredible - not because they have anything planned, but perhaps more because they don’t.

blog.name: randomafwritings
blog.title: The Random Writings Of Someone Who Is Bored
blog.description:
I have no life, so here is a blog where I will sometimes post what I write.

Requests: Open

summary: Psst hello hi. I’m very very sick rn (pending diagnosis for endometriosis but could potentially be GI related, either way it’s...
question: Psst hello hi. I’m very very sick rn (pending diagnosis for endometriosis but could potentially be GI related, either way it’s likely a chronic issue) and when I’m sad I always turn to fluffy Dan x Reader fics bc yes, I am trash. Wondered if I could get some snuggly fluff please & thanks? I can offer nothing but undying gratitude in return. 😬✌🏻👌🏻
answer:
Pairing: Dan x reader

Requests: open

I’m sorry that it’s kinda short and that it’s late. I accidentally took a break over the weekend. I hope you enjoy it and that you feel better.

~

Knocking on Dan and Phil’s door, you contemplated on life up until this point. You had met the by accident while on a trip in London. You had gotten lost and while trying to find your way back to hotel, your phone had died. Somehow Phil was able to see your distress and walk over to help you. You had been friends with the boys ever since.

You had been dating Dan for a year now. Due to the fact that you lived quite far away, it was rare that you got to see each other, which is why you were currently stood outside their door, intending to surprise Dan.

Phil opened the door and indicated for you to be quiet. “Dan’s filming a video right now.” He whispered. You nodded then moved through the house to stand outside of Dan’s door. You waited until he was signing out the video to make yourself known. Stepping through the door, Dan spun around in his chair to see you. The look of delight in his face was worth the wait.

“(Y/N)! What are you doing here?” Dan stood up to embrace you in a tight hug. Swaying from side to side, he nuzzled in your hair.

“I decided to surprise you.” You whispered.

“This is the best surprise ever.” Dan mumbled. “I just realised that the camera is still filming.” You both laughed. “This is gonna stay in the video.”

reblog.comment:
Pairing: Dan x reader

tags: give it a reblog if you liked it please? it helps me out a lot! :)
summary: in the darkness, with you - chapter 13: friendship
title: in the darkness, with you - chapter 13: friendship
body:
Read from the start: https://archiveofourown.org/works/15674688/chapters/36415200

Read chapter 13:
https://archiveofourown.org/works/15674688/chapters/37541738

This fic is COMPLETE and will be posted twice a week (Sun/Thurs)!

THANK YOU to my amazing beta @insectbah  ❤️

Summary:
Phil, 28, video editor.
Phil doesn’t believe in love at first sight, and that is not about to change anytime soon. But what about lust? Just two short weeks ago, he’d say no, definitely not.

Not anymore. Not since he first locked eyes with Dan, the new intern at the company he works for. Not since he first thought, “I want him”.

Phil’s wish does come true, but there’s a catch.
It doesn’t mean anything.

Excerpt from chapter 13:
“I’m gonna break rule two,” Dan breathes. “Again.”
Phil almost expects Dan to kiss him. His whole body is aching, begging for the feeling of Dan’s lips on his. But that is not what Dan does.
